xxl.core.collections.containers
Class UnmodifiableContainer

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.containers.AbstractContainer
      xxl.core.collections.containers.ConstrainedDecoratorContainer
          xxl.core.collections.containers.UnmodifiableContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Container
public class UnmodifiableContainer
extends ConstrainedDecoratorContainer

This class provides a decorator for a given container that cannot be modified. The methods of this class call the corresponding methods of the internally stored container except the methods that modify the bag. These methods (insert, remove, update and clear) throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Note that the ids and objects method returns an UnmodifiableCursor.

Usage example (1). 

     // create a new container

     MapContainer inputContainer = new MapContainer();

     // create an iteration over 20 random Integers (between 0 and 100)

     Iterator iterator = new DiscreteRandomNumber(new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(100), 20);

     // insert all elements of the given iterator

     while (iterator.hasNext())
         inputContainer.insert(iterator.next());

     // create a new unmodifiable container with the given container

     UnmodifiableContainer container = new UnmodifiableContainer(inputContainer);

     // generate a cursor that iterates over all elements of the container

     Cursor cursor = container.objects();

     // print all elements of the cursor (container)

     while (cursor.hasNext())
         System.out.println(cursor.next());

     // close the open iterator, cursor and container after use

     ((Cursor)iterator).close();
     cursor.close();
     container.close();

See Also:
Cursor, Function, Iterator, NoSuchElementException, UnmodifiableCursor

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function<java.lang.Object,UnmodifiableContainer> FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new unmodifiable container. It may only be invoked with a parameter list (for further details see Function) of containers. The parameter list will be used to initialize the decorated container by calling the constructor UnmodifiableContainer((Container) list.get(0)).

See Also:
Function
Constructor Detail

UnmodifiableContainer

public UnmodifiableContainer(Container container)
Constructs a new unmodifiable container that decorates the specified container.

Parameters:
container - the container to be decorated.
Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
           throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Removes all elements from the Container. After a call of this method, size() will return 0. This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
clear in interface Container
Overrides:
clear in class ConstrainedDecoratorContainer
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - when the method is not supported.

insert

public java.lang.Object insert(java.lang.Object object,
                               boolean unfix)
                        throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Inserts a new object into the container and returns the unique identifier that the container has been associated to the object. The identifier can be reused again when the object is deleted from the buffer. If unfixed, the object can be removed from the buffer. Otherwise, it has to be kept in the buffer until an unfix() is called.
This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
insert in interface Container
Overrides:
insert in class ConstrainedDecoratorContainer
Parameters:
object - is the new object.
unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
Returns:
the identifier of the object.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - when the method is not supported.

remove

public void remove(java.lang.Object id)
            throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                   java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Removes the object with identifier id. An exception is thrown when an object with an identifier id is not in the container.
This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
remove in interface Container
Overrides:
remove in class ConstrainedDecoratorContainer
Parameters:
id - an identifier of an object.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier id is not in the container.
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - when the method is not supported.

update

public void update(java.lang.Object id,
                   java.lang.Object object,
                   boolean unfix)
            throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                   java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Overwrites an existing (id,*)-element by (id, object). This method throws an exception if an object with an identifier id does not exist in the container.
This implementation always throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
update in interface Container
Overrides:
update in class ConstrainedDecoratorContainer
Parameters:
id - identifier of the element.
object - the new object that should be associated to id.
unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier id does not exist in the container.
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - when the method is not supported.

objects

public Cursor objects()
Returns an unmodifiable cursor containing all objects of the container. The order in which the cursor delivers the objects is not specified.

Specified by:

Overrides:
